user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of can_compress:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
can_compress (struct MHD_Connection *con)
{
  const char *ae;
  const char *de;

  ae = MHD_lookup_connection_value (con,
                                    MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                    MHD_HTTP_HEADER_ACCEPT_ENCODING);
  if (NULL == ae)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (0 == strcmp (ae,
                   "*"))
    return MHD_YES;
  de = strstr (ae,
               "deflate");
  if (NULL == de)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (((de == ae) ||
       (de[-1] == ',') ||
       (de[-1] == ' ')) &&
      ((de[strlen ("deflate")] == '\0') ||
       (de[strlen ("deflate")] == ',') ||
       (de[strlen ("deflate")] == ';')))
    return MHD_YES;
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I found no code fragments that are provably unreachable in this function. Reasoning: all return statements are conditional and can be reached for different inputs (ae null, ae == "*", no "deflate", match conditions true/false). The pointer-indexing expressions de[-1] and de[strlen("deflate")] are protected by short-circuit logical operators (the checks that could access de[-1] only occur when de != ae, because (de == ae) is the first disjunct) and so are not statically unreachable; they may execute for some runtime inputs. There are no constant conditions, infinite loops, or code following an unconditional return that could never be executed in any build. Therefore, there is no evidence of unreachable code that requires investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
